intro: Cnidium atropurpureum, commonly known as purple cnidium, is a flowering plant native to southern China and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, often fragrant, umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
